title: Ray Sinel
text:
Ray Sinel is a New Zealand former <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who represented <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> in the <a href="1968%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">1968 World Cup</a>.
Playing career.
A member of the <a href="Ellerslie%20Eagles">Ellerslie</a> club, Sinel played for combined Eastern United side in the <a href="Auckland%20Rugby%20League">Auckland Rugby League</a> competition. In 1963 he won the Rothville Trophy as Auckland's player of the year. He was an <a href="Auckland%20rugby%20league%20team">Auckland</a> representative and was part of the Auckland side that defeated <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australia</a> 15-14 in 1969.
Sinel was first selected for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand national rugby league team</a> in 1963. He went on to play in ten test matches for <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> and was part of the squad for the <a href="1968%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">1968 World Cup</a>.
